  16. (* Interpretation of TSL blocks and operations on test trees *)

  18. open Tsl_ast

  20. ‌let string_of_location loc =
  21.   let buf = Buffer.create 64 in
  22.   let fmt = Format.formatter_of_buffer buf in
  23.   Location.print_loc fmt loc;
  24.   Format.pp_print_flush fmt ();
  25.   Buffer.contents buf

  27. ‌let no_such_variable loc name =
  28.   let locstr = string_of_location loc in
  29.   Printf.eprintf "%s\nNo such variable %s\n%!" locstr name;
  30.   exit 2

  32. ‌let no_such_modifiers loc name =
  33.   let locstr = string_of_location loc in
  34.   Printf.eprintf "%s\nNo such modifiers %s\n%!" locstr name;
  35.   exit 2

  37. ‌let apply_modifiers env modifiers_name =
  38.   let name = modifiers_name.node in
  39.   let modifier = Environments.Include name in
  40.   try Environments.apply_modifier env modifier with
  41.   | Environments.Modifiers_name_not_found name ->
  42.     no_such_modifiers modifiers_name.loc name

  44. ‌let rec add_to_env decl loc variable_name value env =
  45.   match (Variables.find_variable variable_name, decl) with
  46.     | (None, true) ->
  47.       let newvar = Variables.make (variable_name,"User variable") in
  48.       Variables.register_variable newvar;
  49. ‌      add_to_env false loc variable_name value env
  50.     | (Some variable, false) ->
  51.       Environments.add variable value env
  52.     | (None, false) ->
  53.       raise (Variables.No_such_variable variable_name)
  54.     | (Some _, true) ->
  55.       raise (Variables.Variable_already_registered variable_name)

  57. let append_to_env loc variable_name value env =
  58.   let variable =
  59.     match Variables.find_variable variable_name with
  60.     | None ->
  61.         raise (Variables.No_such_variable variable_name)
  62.     | Some variable ->
  63.         variable
  64.   in
  65.   try
  66. ‌    Environments.append variable value env
  67.   with Variables.No_such_variable name ->
  68.     no_such_variable loc name

  70. let interpret_environment_statement env statement = match statement.node with
  71.   | Assignment (decl, var, value) ->
  72. ‌      add_to_env decl statement.loc var.node value.node env
  73.   | Append (var, value) ->
  74.       append_to_env statement.loc var.node value.node env
  75.   | Include modifiers_name ->
  76.       apply_modifiers env modifiers_name
  77.   | Unset var ->
  78.       let var =
  79.         match Variables.find_variable var.node with
  80.         | None -> Variables.make (var.node,"User variable")
  81.         | Some var -> var
  82.       in
  83.       Environments.unsetenv var env

  85. ‌let interpret_environment_statements env l =
  86.   List.fold_left interpret_environment_statement env l

  88. ‌type test_tree =
  89.   | Node of
  90.     (Tsl_ast.environment_statement located list) *
  91.     Tests.t *
  92.     string located list *
  93.     (test_tree list)

  95. ‌let too_deep testname max_level real_level =
  96.   Printf.eprintf "Test %s should have depth atmost %d but has depth %d\n%!"
  97.     testname max_level real_level;
  98.   exit 2

  100. ‌let unexpected_environment_statement s =
  101.   let locstr = string_of_location s.loc in
  102.   Printf.eprintf "%s\nUnexpected environment statement\n%!" locstr;
  103.   exit 2

  105. ‌let no_such_test_or_action t =
  106.   let locstr = string_of_location t.loc in
  107.   Printf.eprintf "%s\nNo such test or action: %s\n%!" locstr t.node;
  108.   exit 2

  110. ‌let test_trees_of_tsl_block tsl_block =
  111.   let rec env_of_lines = function
  112.     | [] -> ([], [])
  113.     | Environment_statement s :: lines ->
  114.       let (env', remaining_lines) = env_of_lines lines in
  115.       (s :: env', remaining_lines)
  116.     | lines -> ([], lines)
  117.   and tree_of_lines depth = function
  118.     | [] -> (None, [])
  119.     | line::remaining_lines as l ->
  120.       begin match line with
  121.         | Environment_statement s -> unexpected_environment_statement s
  122.         | Test (test_depth, located_name, env_modifiers) ->
  123.           begin
  124.             let name = located_name.node in
  125.             if test_depth > depth then too_deep name depth test_depth
  126.             else if test_depth < depth then (None, l)
  127.             else
  128.               let (env, rem) = env_of_lines remaining_lines in
  129.               let (trees, rem) = trees_of_lines (depth+1) rem in
  130.               match Tests.lookup name with
  131.                 | None ->
  132.                   begin match Actions.lookup name with
  133.                     | None -> no_such_test_or_action located_name
  134.                     | Some action ->
  135.                       let test = Tests.test_of_action action in
  136.                       (Some (Node (env, test, env_modifiers, trees)), rem)
  137.                   end
  138.                 | Some test ->
  139.                   (Some (Node (env, test, env_modifiers, trees)), rem)
  140.           end
  141.       end
  142. ‌  and trees_of_lines depth lines =
  143.     let remaining_lines = ref lines in
  144.     let trees = ref [] in
  145.     let continue = ref true in
  146.     while !continue; do
  147.       let (tree, rem) = tree_of_lines depth !remaining_lines in
  148.       remaining_lines := rem;
  149.       match tree with
  150.         | None -> continue := false
  151.         | Some t -> trees := t :: !trees
  152.     done;
  153.     (List.rev !trees, !remaining_lines) in
  154. ‌  let (env, rem) = env_of_lines tsl_block in
  155. ‌  let (trees, rem) = trees_of_lines 1 rem in
  156.   match rem with
  157.     | [] -> (env, trees)
  158.     | (Environment_statement s)::_ -> unexpected_environment_statement s
  159.     | _ -> assert false

  161. ‌let rec tests_in_tree_aux set = function Node (_, test, _, subtrees) ->
  162.   let set' = List.fold_left tests_in_tree_aux set subtrees in
  163.   Tests.TestSet.add test set'

  165. ‌let tests_in_tree t = tests_in_tree_aux Tests.TestSet.empty t

  167. ‌let tests_in_trees subtrees =
  168.   List.fold_left tests_in_tree_aux Tests.TestSet.empty subtrees

  170. ‌let actions_in_test test =
  171.   let add action_set action = Actions.ActionSet.add action action_set in
  172.   List.fold_left add Actions.ActionSet.empty test.Tests.test_actions

  174. ‌let actions_in_tests tests =
  175.   let f test action_set =
  176.     Actions.ActionSet.union (actions_in_test test) action_set in
  177.   Tests.TestSet.fold f tests Actions.ActionSet.empty
